thread.title: CBRE names new leader for Houston market
thread.title_full: CBRE names new leader for Houston market

title: CBRE names new leader for Houston market
text:
Courtesy CBRE CBRE Group Inc. (NYSE: CBG) promoted Cody Armbrister to lead the commercial real estate… more CBRE Group Inc. (NYSE: CBG) promoted Cody Armbrister to lead the commercial real estate firm’s Houston market as senior managing director. Armbrister, most recently an executive vice president, is taking over the Houston operations from John Holland , who was executive managing director . Holland still is considering his next move, the Houston Chronicle reports . In his new role, Armbrister will oversee CBRE’s two Houston offices and more than 600 employees, and he will work closely with Mark Taylor , who will continue to lead investor services for the Houston market. He will be responsible for overseeing all lines of business, including brokerage, capital markets, property and facilities, management, valuation and project management. Over his career, Armbrister has completed more than 625 office leases, worth more than $2.75 billion combined, and has consistently been a top performer for CBRE in the Houston area. “Cody is a highly capable leader who has a deep understanding of our company and the needs of our clients in the Houston market,” Michael Caffey , executive managing director for CBRE’s Texas region, said in an Aug. 14 statement. “As he transitions from a producer role to one in leadership, his collaborative nature and ability to bring the right experts together will serve our professionals and clients well.” Los Angeles-based CBRE is the largest Houston-area commercial real estate brokerage firm, based on its 119 local licensed professionals as of January, according to Houston Business Journal research.
